page.title: 16Harrock Hall near Parbold
page.content: The original Hall was built in the 15th Century,the Elizabethan period. The Rigbye family owned it for centuries, but during the last 50 years there have been 13 owners.7 years ago it was almost derelict but now it is rebuilt, looking very impressive.There are 14 rooms in the main building,and 5 rooms in a nearby "cottage" which is to be used as a tied-cottage.The Hall is occupied by the farm manager who runs the 210 acre farm.There is a 5 bay Dutch barn,cowsheds,box stalls,bull pens,a straw yard,milking parlour,calf pens and a barn for silage.Cattle are sold alternate years at the farm.People from Canada and America stay at the Hall when they come to look at the Holstein cattle.
